text: Edwin Monroe Cronk (May 20, 1918 â€“ September 1, 2020) was an American politician. He was the third United States Ambassador to Singapore from 1972 to 1975 during the Richard Nixon and Gerald Ford presidencies.Stewart, John,Shortchanging your Retirement May 2007, fredericknewspost.com. Retrieved March 2011 He was born in Minneapolis. He was Dean and Director of Deep Springs College from 1976 to 1980. Cronk died on September 1, 2020 at the age of 102.Edwin Cronk obituary ==References== Category:1918 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American centenarians Category:Ambassadors of the United States Category:Politicians from Minneapolis Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: Edwin M. Cronk
